Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class Worker

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.Worker
public class Worker
extends java.lang.Object
This class contains information about the state of a single worker. Players in game have two different worker and every worker has the possibility to move and build on the Board. Workers are associated to a Player who can move them. Every worker has a different position (Cell) on the board from the others and they are all on the same Board. The class include methods to control the movement and construction of workers.

  • Constructor Details

    • Worker

      Worker​(Player player, Board board, java.lang.String workerType)
      Worker is the builder of the class. At the moment of a worker creation a player is associated to it and the relative board in which the player is playing.
      Parameters:
      player - indicates the player who has the control on the worker being created.
      board - indicates the board table in which the player is involved in.
      workerType - the type of the Worker. Can be WORKER_FIRST or WORKER_SECOND.
      See Also:
      Command.WORKER_FIRST, Command.WORKER_SECOND

  • Method Details

    • getPosition

      public Cell getPosition()
      This method returns the cell in which worker is at the moment of invocation. It returns a valid cell every time it is invoked after the first invocation of setInitialPosition method.
      Returns:
      the cell in which the worker is, returns null if no cell is yet associated to it.

    • getPreviousPositionBlockType

      public BlockType getPreviousPositionBlockType()
      Previous position's BlockType getter. It's used to check standard win conditions.
      Returns:
      the level of the previous Worker's position.
      See Also:
      GodStrategy.checkWinCondition(Worker)

    • setInitialPosition

      public void setInitialPosition​(int row, int col) throws CellNotEmptyException
      This method sets the first cell of a worker
      Parameters:
      row - indicates the row position associated to a single worker at the beginning of the match
      col - indicates the column position associated to a single worker at the beginning of the match
      Throws:
      CellNotEmptyException

    • standardCheckMove

      public boolean standardCheckMove​(Cell moveCell)
      This method implements the standard checks that have to be done if a Player wants to move a Worker following the standard set of rules.
      Parameters:
      moveCell - the cell in which the Player want to move the worker.
      Returns:
      true if (AND conditions): - The Worker hasn't already performed a move or a build; - The new Cell is adjacent to the current Worker's position; - The new Cell is empty; - The new Cell level is not DOME.

    • standardCheckBuild

      public boolean standardCheckBuild​(Cell buildCell, BlockType buildCellBlockType)
      This method implements the standard checks that have to be done if a Player wants to use a Worker to build a block, following the standard set of rules.
      Parameters:
      buildCell - the cell in which the Player want to build a new level.
      buildCellBlockType - [optional] the specific level that the Worker wants to build.
      Returns:
      true if (AND conditions): - The Worker has already performed a move but NOT another build; - The build Cell is adjacent to the current Worker's position; - The build Cell is empty; - The build Cell level is not DOME. * @param buildCell

    • move

      public void move​(Cell moveCell)
      This method allows worker to move to a cell that is specified as parameter. Respecting the playing condition a worker can move to another cell only if no other worker is on it and the cell is not at the maximum level it can reach and the cell is adjacent to the cell the worker is at the moment of invocation. The worker can move up at most one level.
      Parameters:
      moveCell - indicates the Cell in which a player wants his worker to move in.

    • build

      public void build​(Cell buildCell, BlockType buildCellBlockType) throws CannotIncreaseLevelException, CellNotEmptyException
      This method allows worker to build into a cell that is specified as parameter. Respecting the playing condition a worker can build in a cell only if no other worker is on it and the cell is not at the maximum level it can reach and the cell is adjacent to the cell the worker is at the moment of invocation. As a result of this method the level of a cell is increased.
      Parameters:
      buildCell - indicates the Cell in which a player wants his worker to build in.
      buildCellBlockType - [optional] the specific level that the Worker wants to build.
      Throws:
      CannotIncreaseLevelException - if the worker tries to build where there's a Dome.
      CellNotEmptyException - if the worker tries to build in an occupied Cell.

    • hasMoved

      public boolean hasMoved()
      Check if this Worker has already moved in this turn.
      Returns:
      true if the worker has already moved, false otherwise.

    • hasBuilt

      public boolean hasBuilt()
      Check if this Worker has already built in this turn.
      Returns:
      true if the worker has already built a level, false otherwise.

    • setHasMoved

      public void setHasMoved()
      hasMoved flag setter

    • setHasBuilt

      public void setHasBuilt()
      hasBuilt flag setter

    • reinitializeBuiltMoved

      public void reinitializeBuiltMoved()
      Used to reset move and build flags. Used at the end of every Player's turn.
      See Also:
      GodStrategy.endPlayerTurn(Player)

    • canMove

      public boolean canMove()
      Checks if this worker has at least an available Cell to move to.
      Returns:
      true if this worker can move, false otherwise.
